overview.ovdesc:
This application specifies for each Document Group (defined in the file DOC.GEN.CONDITION), the requirements for documents tracking.
This is a Company specific application and records of this application could
be reversed.

desc.p: Specifies whether the Document Type is mandatory (Value of YES) or optional (Value of NO) for the group. T24 would track only required documents, which are defined as mandatory.
Allowed values are YES/NO.
Default value is YES.
Input mandatory when DOCUMENT.TYPE is specified.
Specifies the related application(s) (other than CUSTOMER) whose required mandatory documents also need to be tracked.
Whether Customer level documents (documents required for CUSTOMER application) need to be tracked or not could be specified by setting the field CHECK.CUST.LEVEL to YES.
For example, refer to help text for the field APPLN.CUS.FLD.
Optional input.
Should be a valid Application Mnemonic (Field APPLN.MNEMONIC) for an application (other than CUSTOMER and current application) specified in the file DM.APPLICATION.INFO.
Associated multi value field.
Duplicate values of RELATED.APPLN and APPLN.CUS.FLD combination not allowed.
Key is in the format Application Name-Document Group.
Example;
CUSTOMER-101 where CUSTOMER is the Application Name and 101 is a Document Group defined for CUSTOMER in DOCUMENT.GENERAL.CONDITION.
LD-201 in which LD is the Application and 201 is a Document Group defined for LD in DOCUMENT.GENERAL.CONDITION.
1-35 Alphanumeric characters.
Specifies the Document types which need to be tracked for the group.
Input optional.
Multi value field.
Must be the ID of a valid record in the file DOCUMENT.TYPE.

For customer level documents (First part of the ID refers to CUSTOMER application), value of the field CONTRACT.SPECIFIC in DOCUMENT.TYPE should be NO. (i.e. cannot specify a Contract specific document as a required document for Customer input).
For application level documents (First part of ID refers to any application other than CUSTOMER), value of the field NEW.ALL.CUST in DOCUMENT.TYPE should be NO or null.

Specifies the Number of days (calculated from a document's Status Date in the file CUST.DOCUMENT or TRANS.DOCUMENT) after which a required Mandatory document with an invalid status, would stop a transaction input.
Example
DOCUMENT.REQUIRED ID-SETR*101 (For document group 101 of SEC.TRADE)
DOCUMENT.TYPE- AGREEMENT
MANDATORY-YES
STOP.TXN-YES
STOP.TXN.DAYS-10

The Document AGREEMENT is recorded in the file CUST.DOCUMENT for Customer ID 1000 with an invalid status and a Status Date of 4.6.2002. Any SEC.TRADE input, for which Document AGREEMENT is required from Customer ID 1000 would be allowed only upto 13.6.2002 (10 days from the Status Date). Any SEC.TRADE input, for which Document AGREEMENT is required from Customer ID 1000 would not be allowed after 13.6.2002.
Optional.
Multi value field associated with field DOCUMENT.TYPE.
Input allowed only if the value of the field STOP.TXN is YES.
1-3 Numeric characters followed by D in the format "xxxD".
If the value of the field STOP.TXN is YES and that of STOP.TXN.DAYS is Null, then transactions which require the Document would be immeidately stopped.

Specifies whether a transaction needs to be stopped, if a required Mandatory document exists with an invalid status or confirmed by the User as "Not Received" for T24 confirmation messages whether a Document has been received.
Stopping the transaction would be subject to the value of the field STOP.TXN.DAYS.
Allowed values are YES/NO.
Input is mandatory if the value of the field MANDATORY is YES.
For non-mandatory documents (value of the field MANDATORY is NO), value of YES is not allowed.
Specifies the name of a customer field in the Related Application.
Documents for the related application would be tracked for the Customer whose ID is equal to the value of this field in the related application's appropriate record.
Example
While inputting a Security Trade in the application SEC.TRADE, required mandatory documents for the Security Account Master of the Customers of the trade need to be tracked.
In DM.APPLICATION.INFO, a record with ID=SEC.ACC.MASTER, and fields with the following values need to be set up: APPLN.MNEMONIC=SAM and CUST.FILED.NAME=CUSTOMER.NUMBER.
In DM.APPLICATION.INFO, another record with ID=SEC.TRADE, and fields with the following values need to be set up: APPLN.MNEMONIC=SETR and CUST.FILED.NAME=CUSTOMER.NO.
In DOC.GEN.CONDITION, a record with ID=SETR*CUSTOMER.NO or ID=SETR and fields with the following values need to be set up: DOC.GROUP=101, and appropriate conditions, if any for the group.
In DOCUMENT.REQUIRED a record with ID: SETR*101 and fields with the following values need to be set up: RELATED.APPLN=SAM, APPLN.ID.LINK=CUST.SEC.ACC and APPLN.CUS.FLD=CUSTOMER.NUMBER.
Multi value field associated with field RELATED.APPLN.
Must be a value of the field CUST.FIELD.NAME in the related application's record, in DM.APPLICATION.INFO.
Mandatory if a value for the field RELATED.APPLN is specified and the field CUST.FIELD.NAME in DM.APPLICATION.INFO (in the related application's record) is not null..
If the value of the field CUST.FILED.NAME in DM.APPLICATION.INFO in the related application's record is not specified, then no value would be allowed in this field.
Specifies the name of a field in the application specified in the first part of the ID (application in which a transaction is input), which links to the related application.
Value of this field would be used as an ID to access the related application's record for document tracking purposes.
If no record exists in the related application with ID equal to the value of this field, then no document tracking would be done for the related application.
For example, refer to help text for the field APPLN.CUS.FLD.
Should be in the Standard Selection of the application specified in the first part of the ID.
Input mandatory if the field RELATED.APPLN has a value.
Input not allowed if the field RELATED.APPLN is not specified.
Multi value field associated with field RELATED.APPLN.
Specifies whether for this group, customer level documents (documents required for CUSTOMER input), should be also tracked in addition to other application level documents.
Input Mandatory.
Allowed values YES/NO.
Default value is YES.
For customer groups (First part of ID refers to CUSTOMER application), this will a be no input field.

For other applications, if the value of the field CUST.FIELD.NAME in DM.APPLICATION.INFO is null (i.e. Documents are not tracked for a direct input in the application), then only allowed value for this field is NO.

t.desc:
This application specifies for a Document Group (defined in the file DOC.GEN.CONDITION), the requirements for documents tracking.
Format of the ID will be "Application Mnemonic*Document Group", where the f
irst part should be the Mnemonic defined for an application in DM.APPLICATION.INFO and second part should be the value of a Document Group No. (field DOC.GROUP in DOC.GEN.CONDITION) for the application defined in the first part.
If no record exists for a Document Group in this file, then documents would be determined as required for that group.
Example
For the application: FUNDS.TRANSFER,
Value of the field APPLN.MNEMONIC in DM.APPLICATION.INFO: FT
One of the values of the field DOC.GROUP in DOC.GEN.CONDITION for the Debit Customer in FT (ID: FT*DEBIT.CUSTOMER): 101
Then the record with the ID "FT*101" in DOCUMENT.REQUIRED would define the requirements for documents tracking, for the Document Group 101 in FT.
Validation Rules:
First part should be the Mnemonic defined for an application in DM.APPLICATION.INFO.
Second part should be the value of a Document Group No. (field DOC.GROUP in DOC.GEN.CONDITION) for the application defined in the first part.
Both parts are mandatory.
Records of this application could be reversed.

desc.p: Specifies whether the document type needs to be tracked for transactions input from a related application (if value is YES) or not (if value is NO).
Example
DOCUMENT.REQUIRED ID: AC*101 (Document Group for the ACCOUNT application)
DOCUMENT.TYPE: ELECSTMT (Electronic Statement Agreement)
MANDATORY: YES
TXN.PROCESSING: NO

The document type ELECSTMT would be tracked whenever an Account input belongs to the Document Group 101. For a Loan input (in LD Application), ACCOUNT is defined as a related application and the appropriate Account belongs to Document Group 101. Since TXN.PROCESSING is set to NO, the document ELECSTMT would not be tracked when a loan is input in LD application.
Mandatory if the value of the field MANDATORY is YES.
Allowed values YES/NO and defaults to YES.
Multi value field associated with field DOCUMENT.TYPE.
